definitions.definition: someone or something existing or happening before, especially as the cause or origin of something existing or happening later:
examples: Charles Babbage's mechanical calculating engines were the antecedents of the modern computer.

definitions.definition: a word or phrase that a pronoun refers back to:
examples: In the sentence "He picked a book off the shelf and handed it to Sally", "book" is the antecedent of "it".
When the college was established in 1546, it inherited a hall from each of three antecedent institutions.
